result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell A Greer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 214 days of sentence credit. On 07/23/2020 the term of probation on count 1 was vacated and the defendant was re-sentenced to jail with time served.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court orders defendant to re-pay the court costs of $518.00 and Ct Appt's Atty Fees of $2,454.79 which have been reduced to a civil judgment. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Vacated 07/23/2020
Letter from Janelle Nehring-Corrections Sentencing Associate Advanced dated 10/07/2020 re: need something stating probation was vacated effective 07/23/2020, either amended JOC or Order
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Erik Johnson)
Defendant, Atty Erik Johnson and DA Andrew Christenson via video.

10:10 a.m. Defendant present in court via video with Atty Erik Johnson via video.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via video. Agent Jay Kelley present via video. Court goes over both cases scheduled for this morning, with a stipulated agreement on 14CF14, being amended to time served. DA concurs. Atty Johnson concurs. On 2019CF40 the Agent submitted a letter stating that the defendant is not doing so well on probation.

2014CF14
Court sentences the defendant to 214 days of county jail, with 214 days sentence credit and if the costs are not paid, need to be paid - 60 days to pay or payment plan.

2019CF40  Court goes over reason for hearing today.  Statement by Atty Johnson, defendant has no issued doing what he needs to do. Statement by the Court - adds a condition of: 90 days of county jail, no huber, out of county service and out of county travel. No huber, out of county service or out of county travel and to commence within 2 weeks. If defendant requests to revoke himself he can do that. If costs are not paid, it will be converted to a civil judgment. Atty Johnson requests a break-out room with the defendant. 10:16 a.m. 10:20 a.m. Back on the record - appearances remain the same. Statement by Atty Johnson regarding revocation. Court questions defendant regarding self revocation. Statement by defendant. Statement by the Court. Defendant requests to talk with his attorney in a break-out room 10:22 a.m. 10:25 a.m. Back on the record.  Parties remain the same. Atty Johnson advises the defendant wishes to revoke himself. Defendant concurs, requests to revoke himself. Court imposes the 90 days county jail, No huber, out of county service or out of county travel. Sentence to commence within 30 days.

Court adjourned at 10:25 a.m.
Hearing on July 23, 2020 at 10:15 am. /  Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Letter to Judge Slate from Janelle Nehring-Corrections Sentencing Associate Advanced) dated 04/07/2020 re: term of probation / sentence on count 1          (Notes: 04/17/2020 - Court takes no action)
Letter to Judge Slate from Maggie Hutchens-Corrections Sentencing Associate Advanced dated 02/21/2020 re: probation sentence       (with Judge note)

records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the appeal is voluntarily dismissed.

10:47 a.m. Defendant present in court with Atty Eric Johnson.  Appellate Counsel Atty Patricia Sommer present via telephone. Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over agreement reached - 2 years probation with 214 days county jail and 214 days of sentence credit and defendant will be withdrawing the appeal; in 2019CF40 the charge will be amended to misdemeanor, imposed and stayed jail time and probation for a period of 1 year, with costs. Statement by Atty Johnson - to make the record clear, the probation on 2014CF14 will commence on 11/21/2017. Statement by Atty Sommer. Court questions defendant regarding appeal rights on 14CF14.  Defendant understands. Statement by Atty Sommer, will withdraw the appeal.  Off the record - 10:52 a.m. Back on the record at 10:53 a.m. 

2014CF14
DA confirms victim witness rights. Statement by Atty Johnson. Statement by defendant. Court will agrees and modifies 2014CF14 sentence to 2 years probation commencing on 11/21/2017 with 214 days of jail and grants the defendant 214 days of sentence credit. Defendant is to pay court costs and complete a DNA sample if not already done.

2019CF40
Defencant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended charge of misdemeanor failure to report to jail (946.425(1m)(a).  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Re-pay the court appointed attorney fees.

Court adjourned at 10:59 a.m.

Atty Patricia Sommer called in regards to the motion hearing scheduled for 01/06 - requests to appear via phone.  Informed Atty Sommer that the Court will call her at the time scheduled.

11:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Johnson - have provided a sentencing recommendation to the court.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by the Court - has read the letters that were submitted, as well as the letter from the doctor and medical documentation.  Sentencing statement by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing statement by Atty Johnson.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs & attorney fees.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-6 months county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-No Contact with the victim. (forms)
-Complete a Psycho Sexual Evaluation.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court grants the defendant 34 days of sentence credit if revoked.

Further statement by the Court regarding medical.

Court adjourned at 12:12 p.m.

12:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Erik Johnson. Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plead to an amended charge of exposing genitals to a minor.  State concurs.  Atty Johnson makes statement.  Defendant concurs.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended charge.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court sets for Sentencing on November 21, 2017 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 12:12 p.m.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Haase.
